trial_identification.studytitle: A comparison of open surgery versus arthroscopic surgery for resection of the acromioclavicular (AC) joint.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A comparison of post-operative and functional outcomes of arthroscopic versus open resection of the acromioclavicular joint: A prospective, randomized study.

interventions.interventions: Resection of the Acromioclavicular joint involves removal of the distal 8-10mm of the lateral clavicle to treat arthritis of the acromioclavicular joint. The resection can either be performed as an open procedure or via arthroscopic surgery. Both procedures are permanent and have a duration of 45 minutes.
interventions.comparator: Open resection of the Acromioclavicular joint involves removal of the distal 8-10mm of the lateral clavicle to treat arthritis of the acromioclavicular joint. The procedure is permanent and the procedure duration is 45 minutes.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 months, six months, one year, two years

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Disability of Arm, Shoulder, Hand (DASH) score

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients undergoing resection of the acromioclavicular joint for arthritis
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: dislocation of AC joint, infection, tumor, rotator cuff disease, labral injuries

trial_design.concealment: Patients placed on waiting list for resection of the acromioclavicular joint at the participating hospital are eligible. Discussion will occur at initial appointment then the patient will be provided with an information sheet. Confirmation will occur at pre-admission. Randomisation performed by statistician and sealed envelopes opened at the time of surgery.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Dept of Orthopaedic Surgery Middlemore Hospital 100 Hospital Road Otahuhu Auckland 2025 Private Bag 93311 Otahuhu Auckland 1640

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Dept of Orthopaedic Surgery Middlemore Hospital 100 Hospital Road Otahuhu Auckland 2025 Private Bag 93311 Otahuhu Auckland 1640

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The study aims to assess the hypothesis that arthroscopic surgery results in an improved functional outcome with less pain than open surgery for resection of the acromioclavicular (AC) joint.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Health and Disability Ethics Committee Northern A
